contentrichtext.text: {{Citation style|date=September 2009}} The '''European Academy for Environmental Affairs''' (also known as: '''European Academy of Environmental Affairs''', is a private organization which gave its label for the [[Leipzig Declaration on Global Climate Change]], a [[Science and Environmental Policy Project|SEPP]]-initiated document in which some scientists argue against [[global warming]] theories. In 1993 this Academy held a conference in [[Mannheim]] under the title "Globale Erwärmung - Tatsache oder Behauptung?" (Global warming—fact or fiction?). On [http://www.iwoe.de/EuropAkademie.html EuropAcademie] there is a list of textbooks on [[ecology]] issued by the Academy. Founder and president of the Academy was the late Prof. Dr. hc. [[Helmut Metzner]] (1925-1999), who was professor for chemical [[plant physiology]]. An article by Metzner about his view on climate change can be found on the right-wing website konservativ.de. He was accused of having strong connections to the [[Studienzentrum Weikersheim]], a right-wing think-tank in [[Baden-Württemberg]]. [http://www.projektwerkstatt.de/oepunkte/althefte/ausgaben/01/54_clinton.html] The Academy was recognized in a consultative function by the [[Council of Europe]], but the status was withdrawn because of the Academy's failure to comply with its obligations.<ref>https://wcd.coe.int/ViewDoc.jsp?id=251911</ref> There are no webpages of the Academy, and there are some hints that is now defunct. It may have ceased operation with the death of [[Helmut Metzner|Metzner]]. {{DEFAULTSORT:European Academy Of Environmental Affairs}} [[Category:Environmental organizations]] {{euro-org-stub}} {{reflist}}
